ARIA Landmark Navigation - IMMEDIATE** ```html
  • About
  • Experience
  • Projects

Professional Experience

``` #### **2. Semantic HTML5 Structure - HIGH PRIORITY** **Current (Problematic)**: ```html
Adrian Wedd
Systems Analyst
Experience
``` **Required (Semantic)**: ```html

Adrian Wedd

Systems Analyst & Developer

Professional Experience

© 2025 Adrian Wedd

``` #### **3. Screen Reader Optimization** ```html Skip to main content Skip to navigation
We'll never share your email with anyone else.
``` #### **4. Color Contrast & Visual Accessibility** ```css /* WCAG 2.1 AA requires minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio */ :root { --text-primary: #1a1a1a; /* 16.94:1 contrast on white */ --text-secondary: #4a4a4a; /* 9.74:1 contrast on white */ --link-color: #0066cc; /* 4.77:1 contrast on white */ --focus-outline: #005fcc; /* High contrast focus indicator */ } /* Focus indicators for keyboard navigation */ a:focus, button:focus, input:focus { outline: 3px solid var(--focus-outline); outline-offset: 2px; } /* Ensure text scales properly */ html { font-size: 100%; /* Respects user preferences */ } ``` ### 🧪 **TESTING REQUIREMENTS** #### **Automated Testing**: ```bash # Install accessibility testing tools npm install -D @axe-core/cli lighthouse # Run accessibility audits npx @axe-core/cli https://adrianwedd.github.io/cv npx lighthouse https://adrianwedd.github.io/cv --only-categories=accessibility # WAVE Web Accessibility Evaluation # Visit: https://wave.webaim.org/report#/https://adrianwedd.github.io/cv ``` #### **Manual Testing Checklist**: - [ ] **Keyboard Navigation**: Tab through all interactive elements - [ ] **Screen Reader**: Test with NVDA/JAWS/VoiceOver - [ ] **Color Contrast**: Verify 4.5:1 ratio for normal text, 3:1 for large text - [ ] **Text Scaling**: Ensure readability at 200% zoom - [ ] **Focus Indicators**: Visible focus states for all interactive elements ### 🎯 **SUCCESS CRITERIA** #### **Accessibility Score Targets**: - **Phase 1**: 35/100 → 60/100 (+25 points) - ARIA landmarks + semantic HTML - **Phase 2**: 60/100 → 80/100 (+20 points) - Screen reader optimization - **Phase 3**: 80/100 → 95/100 (+15 points) - WCAG 2.1 AA full compliance #### **Compliance Requirements**: - [ ] WCAG 2.1 AA Level compliance (95/100+) - [ ] Zero critical accessibility violations - [ ] Screen reader compatibility verified - [ ] Keyboard navigation fully functional - [ ] Color contrast ratios meet standards ### 🚀 **IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY** #### **Week 1: Semantic Structure Foundation** 1. Convert div-based layout to semantic HTML5 2. Implement ARIA landmark navigation 3. Add proper heading hierarchy (h1 → h2 → h3) 4. Basic keyboard navigation testing #### **Week 2: Enhanced Accessibility Features** 1. Add skip navigation links 2. Implement comprehensive ARIA attributes 3. Optimize for screen readers 4. Color contrast validation and fixes #### **Week 3: Testing & Compliance Verification** 1. Automated accessibility testing (axe-core, Lighthouse) 2. Manual screen reader testing 3. Keyboard navigation comprehensive testing 4. WCAG 2.1 AA compliance certification ### 🔗 **DEPENDENCIES & INTEGRATION** - **Requires**: Security infrastructure (#231) - secure foundation needed - **Enables**: SEO technical excellence (structured data benefits from semantic HTML) - **Blocks**: Enterprise client evaluation - accessibility is mandatory ### 📊 **BUSINESS & LEGAL IMPACT** **COMPLIANCE BENEFITS**: - Legal requirement for government contracts - Enterprise client accessibility standards - Search engine ranking improvement (accessibility signals) - Inclusive design demonstrates professional values **RISK MITIGATION**: - Avoids accessibility lawsuit exposure - Ensures compliance with disability rights legislation - Meets enterprise procurement requirements **QUALITY IMPROVEMENT**: +30 points toward authentic 100/100 enterprise score --- **Implementation Guide**: See `/.github/scripts/data/validation/implementation-guide-accessibility.md` **Testing Tools**: axe-core, Lighthouse, WAVE, screen readers **Compliance Standard**: WCAG 2.1 AA Level

issue.title: 🔴 P0 CRITICAL: Security Infrastructure Implementation - CSP, HSTS, SRI Framework

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: reliability
labels.description: Related to system stability and error handling

labels.name: validation
labels.description: Related to data and schema validation

labels.name: P0: Critical
labels.description: Highest priority; must be addressed immediately

issue.body:
## 🚨 **CRITICAL SECURITY IMPLEMENTATION REQUIRED**

**PRIORITY**: P0 Critical - Security vulnerabilities detected  
**IMPACT**: +60 points quality improvement (20/100 → 80/100 security category)  
**TIMELINE**: 1-2 weeks implementation  
**RISK**: Production exposure to XSS, CDN attacks, HTTPS bypass

### 🔍 **SECURITY AUDIT FINDINGS**

**Current Security Score**: 20/100 ❌ CRITICAL FAILURE  
**Enterprise Requirement**: 95/100+ for production deployment

#### **Critical Vulnerabilities Identified**:

1. **CRITICAL**: Missing Content Security Policy (CSP) - **XSS vulnerability exposure**
2. **CRITICAL**: No Strict Transport Security (HSTS) - **HTTPS not enforced**  
3. **HIGH**: Missing Subresource Integrity (SRI) - **CDN attack vulnerability**
4. **MEDIUM**: Incomplete security headers framework

### 📋 **IMPLEMENTATION REQUIREMENTS**

#### **1. Content Security Policy (CSP) - IMMEDIATE**
```html
<!-- Add to <head> section of index.html -->
<meta http-equiv="Content-Security-Policy" 
      content="default-src 'self'; 
               script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' https://cdn.jsdelivr.net; 
               style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; 
               img-src 'self' data: https:; 
               font-src 'self' https://fonts.gstatic.com;">
```

**Verification**:
```bash
curl -I https://adrianwedd.github.io/cv | grep -i content-security-policy
```

#### **2. Strict Transport Security (HSTS) - IMMEDIATE**
```html
<!-- Add to <head> section of index.html -->
<meta http-equiv="Strict-Transport-Security" 
      content="max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains">
```

**Verification**:
```bash
curl -I https://adrianwedd.github.io/cv | grep -i strict-transport-security
```

#### **3. Subresource Integrity (SRI) - HIGH PRIORITY**
```html
<!-- Update all external script/link tags -->
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/library@1.0.0/dist/lib.min.js" 
        integrity="sha384-oqVuAfXRKap7fdgcCY5uykM6+R9GqQ8K/uxy9rx7HNQlGYl1kPzQho1wx4JwY8wC" 
        crossorigin="anonymous"></script>
```

**Generate SRI Hashes**:
```bash
curl -s https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/library@1.0.0/dist/lib.min.js | openssl dgst -sha384 -binary | openssl base64 -A
```

#### **4. Additional Security Headers**
```html
<!-- Enhanced security header framework -->
<meta http-equiv="X-Content-Type-Options" content="nosniff">
<meta http-equiv="X-Frame-Options" content="DENY">
<meta http-equiv="Referrer-Policy" content="strict-origin-when-cross-origin">
<meta http-equiv="Permissions-Policy" content="geolocation=(), microphone=(), camera=()">
```

### 🎯 **SUCCESS CRITERIA**

#### **Security Score Targets**:
- **Phase 1**: 20/100 → 65/100 (+45 points) - CSP + HSTS implementation
- **Phase 2**: 65/100 → 85/100 (+20 points) - SRI + additional headers  
- **Phase 3**: 85/100 → 95/100 (+10 points) - Security audit compliance

#### **Verification Requirements**:
- [ ] CSP header present and functional
- [ ] HSTS enforces HTTPS redirection
- [ ] All external resources have SRI hashes
- [ ] No console security warnings
- [ ] Security scanner verification (OWASP ZAP)

### 🚀 **IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY**

#### **Week 1: Critical Headers**
1. Implement CSP meta tag with appropriate directives
2. Add HSTS header for HTTPS enforcement
3. Test all functionality with new security policies
4. Verify no console errors or blocked resources

#### **Week 2: Resource Integrity + Audit**
1. Generate and implement SRI hashes for all external resources
2. Add comprehensive security header framework
3. Run automated security scan (OWASP ZAP)
4. Document security implementation and testing procedures

### 🔗 **RELATED ISSUES**

- **Blocks**: All PWA and performance optimization (requires secure foundation)
- **Depends**: Quality validation framework (#230)
- **Follow-up**: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance implementation

### 📊 **BUSINESS IMPACT**

**RISK MITIGATION**: Eliminates critical security vulnerabilities affecting:
- Professional credibility and trust
- Search engine ranking (HTTPS requirement)
- Enterprise client evaluation criteria
- Compliance with modern web security standards

**QUALITY IMPROVEMENT**: +60 points toward authentic 100/100 enterprise score

---

**Implementation Guide**: See `/.github/scripts/data/validation/implementation-guide-security.md`  
**Testing Framework**: Comprehensive security validation available  
**Certification**: Required for CV-QV enterprise certification renewal

issue.body:
## Feature Request: AI/ML Model Orchestration Pipeline

### Summary
Implement a comprehensive AI/ML model orchestration system that automates model training, deployment, monitoring, and responsible AI practices within the claude-nexus ecosystem.

### Problem Statement
Current AI/ML implementations lack:
- Automated model lifecycle management
- Continuous bias detection and mitigation
- Multi-modal AI system integration capabilities
- Production-ready MLOps pipeline with proper governance
- Real-time model performance monitoring and drift detection

### Proposed Solution

#### 1. Automated Model Training & Deployment Pipeline
- **Continuous Training**: Automated retraining pipelines triggered by data drift detection
- **Model Versioning**: Comprehensive model artifact management with rollback capabilities
- **A/B Testing Framework**: Automated model comparison and gradual rollout strategies
- **Edge Deployment**: Optimized model compression and edge inference capabilities

#### 2. Responsible AI Implementation
- **Bias Detection Framework**: Automated fairness metrics across protected attributes
- **Explainability Tools**: LIME/SHAP integration for model interpretability
- **Privacy-Preserving ML**: Differential privacy and federated learning support
- **Ethical AI Guidelines**: Automated compliance checking and audit trails

#### 3. Multi-Modal AI Architecture
- **Vision-Language Integration**: Seamless image, text, and speech processing
- **Cross-Modal Reasoning**: Unified embedding spaces for multi-modal understanding
- **Adaptive Input Processing**: Dynamic routing based on input modality
- **Real-time Inference Serving**: Optimized multi-modal model serving infrastructure

#### 4. Intelligent Monitoring & Observability
- **Model Drift Detection**: Statistical and learned drift detection algorithms
- **Performance Analytics**: Real-time accuracy, latency, and resource utilization metrics
- **Data Quality Monitoring**: Automated feature validation and anomaly detection
- **Alert System**: Intelligent alerting for model degradation and bias drift

### Technical Implementation

#### Core Components
```python
# Model Orchestration Engine
class ModelOrchestrator:
    def __init__(self):
        self.bias_detector = BiasDetectionFramework()
        self.model_registry = ModelRegistry()
        self.deployment_manager = DeploymentManager()
        self.monitoring_service = ModelMonitoringService()
    
    async def deploy_model(self, model_artifact, deployment_config):
        # Automated bias testing before deployment
        bias_report = await self.bias_detector.evaluate(model_artifact)
        if bias_report.meets_fairness_criteria():
            return await self.deployment_manager.deploy(model_artifact, deployment_config)
        else:
            raise BiasDetectionError(bias_report)

# Multi-Modal AI Router
class MultiModalRouter:
    def route_request(self, input_data):
        modality = self.detect_modality(input_data)
        return self.get_optimal_model(modality, input_data.complexity)
```

#### Infrastructure Requirements
- **Container Orchestration**: Kubernetes-native ML serving with auto-scaling
- **Model Storage**: Distributed model artifact storage with versioning
- **Feature Store**: Real-time and batch feature serving infrastructure
- **Experiment Tracking**: MLflow/Weights & Biases integration
- **CI/CD Integration**: GitHub Actions workflows for ML model deployment

### Acceptance Criteria

#### Phase 1: Foundation (Weeks 1-4)
- [ ] Model registry with versioning and metadata management
- [ ] Basic bias detection framework with standard fairness metrics
- [ ] Automated model deployment pipeline with rollback capabilities
- [ ] Real-time model performance monitoring dashboard

#### Phase 2: Advanced Features (Weeks 5-8)
- [ ] Multi-modal AI routing and inference serving
- [ ] Advanced bias mitigation techniques (adversarial debiasing, fairness constraints)
- [ ] Edge deployment optimization with model quantization
- [ ] Comprehensive explainability tools integration

#### Phase 3: Production Hardening (Weeks 9-12)
- [ ] Advanced drift detection with automated retraining triggers
- [ ] Privacy-preserving ML capabilities (differential privacy, federated learning)
- [ ] Comprehensive audit logging and compliance reporting
- [ ] Performance optimization and cost management tools

### Success Metrics
- **Model Deployment Time**: Reduce from hours to minutes
- **Bias Detection Coverage**: 95% automated fairness evaluation
- **Model Performance**: 99.9% inference availability with <100ms latency
- **Operational Efficiency**: 80% reduction in manual ML operations tasks
- **Compliance**: 100% audit trail coverage for regulatory requirements

### Dependencies
- Claude API integration for LLM capabilities
- Kubernetes cluster for model serving infrastructure
- GPU/TPU resources for model training and inference
- Data pipeline integration for feature engineering
- Security framework for model access control

### Risk Assessment
- **Technical Risks**: Model drift in production, inference latency spikes
- **Mitigation**: Comprehensive monitoring, automated rollback procedures
- **Compliance Risks**: Bias in production models, privacy violations
- **Mitigation**: Automated bias testing, privacy-preserving techniques

### Additional Considerations
- **Scalability**: Design for 10x growth in model serving requests
- **Security**: Zero-trust model access with comprehensive audit logging
- **Cost Optimization**: Intelligent resource allocation and auto-scaling
- **Developer Experience**: Intuitive APIs and comprehensive documentation

This feature would establish claude-nexus as a leader in responsible AI deployment, providing developers with production-ready MLOps capabilities that prioritize fairness, transparency, and reliability.

---
**Priority**: High  
**Effort**: Large (12 weeks)  
**Impact**: Critical for AI/ML adoption and responsible deployment

## Summary

Implement an intelligent development environment provisioning system that automatically configures optimal workflows based on project type, team preferences, and productivity patterns. This feature would eliminate the friction of manual environment setup and ensure consistent, optimized development experiences across teams.

## Problem Statement

Developers currently face significant friction when:
- Setting up new development environments (hours to days of configuration)
- Onboarding new team members (inconsistent environment setups)
- Context switching between projects (different toolchains, configurations)
- Maintaining optimal workflow configurations as projects evolve
- Identifying and eliminating productivity bottlenecks in their workflows

## Proposed Solution

### Core Components

1. **Environment Templates Engine**
   - Pre-configured templates for common project types (React, Python, Go, etc.)
   - Intelligent dependency detection and auto-installation
   - IDE configuration synchronization (VS Code settings, extensions, themes)
   - Container-based environment isolation with hot-reload capabilities

2. **Workflow Analytics Dashboard**
   - Real-time productivity metrics (build times, test execution, deployment cycles)
   - Bottleneck identification and automated optimization suggestions
   - Team-wide workflow comparison and best practice sharing
   - Integration with existing development tools (GitHub, CI/CD, IDEs)

3. **Automated Optimization System**
   - Machine learning-based workflow pattern recognition
   - Proactive suggestions for tool integration improvements
   - Automated code quality pipeline setup
   - Performance monitoring and auto-scaling for development resources

4. **Seamless Tool Integration Hub**
   - Unified interface for disparate development tools
   - Context-aware tool switching and configuration
   - API orchestration for complex multi-tool workflows
   - Single sign-on and credential management across tools

### Implementation Benefits

- **Reduced Onboarding Time**: From days to minutes for new developers
- **Increased Focus Time**: Eliminate context switches and manual configuration tasks
- **Improved Code Quality**: Automated quality gates and optimization suggestions
- **Enhanced Team Productivity**: Shared best practices and standardized workflows
- **Data-Driven Optimization**: Continuous improvement based on real usage patterns

## Technical Requirements

- Integration with popular IDEs (VS Code, JetBrains, Vim/Neovim)
- Support for containerized development environments (Docker, DevContainers)
- CI/CD pipeline integration (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins)
- Cross-platform compatibility (macOS, Linux, Windows)
- Extensible plugin architecture for custom integrations
- Real-time collaboration features for team environments

## Success Metrics

- Reduction in environment setup time (target: 90% reduction)
- Increase in developer satisfaction scores
- Decrease in context-switching related productivity loss
- Improvement in code quality metrics (test coverage, deployment success rates)
- Adoption rate across development teams

## Implementation Phases

**Phase 1**: Core environment provisioning with basic templates
**Phase 2**: Analytics dashboard and workflow monitoring
**Phase 3**: ML-based optimization engine and recommendations
**Phase 4**: Advanced team collaboration and knowledge sharing features

## User Stories

- As a new developer, I want to clone a repository and have my complete development environment ready in under 5 minutes
- As a team lead, I want to ensure all team members have identical, optimized development setups
- As a DevOps engineer, I want visibility into team productivity patterns to identify infrastructure improvements
- As a developer, I want my tools to learn my preferences and automatically optimize my workflow over time

This feature would position claude-nexus as the definitive platform for developer experience optimization, addressing one of the most significant pain points in modern software development.

## Feature Request: Advanced Mutation Testing Framework

### Problem Statement
Current testing strategies in the claude-nexus ecosystem lack comprehensive mutation testing capabilities and advanced quality gates that can predict and prevent potential failures before they reach production. We need a robust framework that goes beyond traditional code coverage metrics to evaluate the actual effectiveness of our test suites.

### Proposed Solution
Implement a comprehensive mutation testing framework with integrated quality gates that provides:

#### Core Components
1. **Mutation Testing Engine**
   - Automated code mutation generation (syntax, logic, and behavioral mutations)
   - Parallel execution support for large codebases
   - Integration with existing CI/CD pipelines
   - Configurable mutation operators for different programming languages

2. **Quality Gate Integration**
   - Mutation score thresholds as deployment gates
   - Performance regression detection through mutated code analysis
   - Automated test suite effectiveness scoring
   - Integration with GitHub branch protection rules

3. **Advanced Analytics Dashboard**
   - Mutation survival analysis and trends
   - Test suite weakness identification
   - Predictive quality metrics
   - Historical mutation score tracking

```yaml
# Example configuration structure
mutation-testing:
  engines:
    - javascript: "stryker"
    - python: "mutmut"
    - go: "go-mutesting"

    minimum-mutation-score: 85
    performance-regression-threshold: 5%
```

issue.body:
## Feature Request: Self-Validating Data Schema Evolution Framework

### Overview
Implement a comprehensive data architecture framework that provides automatic schema validation, seamless migration capabilities, and content verification systems for the claude-nexus ecosystem. This framework would ensure data integrity, prevent breaking changes, and maintain content authenticity across system evolution.

### Problem Statement
Current challenges in data management systems:
- Schema changes often break existing integrations without warning
- Data migrations lack automated rollback capabilities
- Content authenticity cannot be verified programmatically
- Performance degradation from unoptimized data structures
- Missing anomaly detection for data quality issues

### Proposed Solution

#### 1. **Schema Validation Engine**
```json
{
  "schemaVersion": "2.0.0",
  "validation": {
    "strict": true,
    "evolutionRules": {
      "allowAdditive": true,
      "preventBreaking": true,
      "deprecationPeriod": "30d"
    }
  },
  "performanceHints": {
    "indexedFields": ["id", "timestamp"],
    "compressionStrategy": "zstd",
    "cachePolicy": "lru"
  }
}
```

#### 2. **Content Verification Framework**
- Multi-layer authenticity scoring system
- Cryptographic signatures for critical data
- Automated anomaly detection using statistical analysis
- Pattern matching for data quality assurance
- Confidence metrics for each data point

#### 3. **Zero-Risk Migration System**
- Automated migration plan generation
- Dry-run capabilities with detailed impact analysis
- Point-in-time rollback with transaction logs
- Parallel migration support for large datasets
- Progress tracking with real-time metrics

#### 4. **Performance Optimization Layer**
- Intelligent schema design recommendations
- Automatic index generation based on query patterns
- Data structure optimization suggestions
- Compression strategy selection
- Query performance profiling

### Technical Implementation

#### Core Components:
1. **Schema Registry Service**
   - Centralized schema versioning
   - Compatibility checking
   - Evolution tracking
   - Breaking change detection

2. **Validation Pipeline**
   ```javascript
   class DataValidator {
     async validate(data, schema) {
       const results = {
         valid: false,
         errors: [],
         warnings: [],
         performanceScore: 0,
         authenticityScore: 0
       };
       
       // Multi-stage validation
       await this.structuralValidation(data, schema);
       await this.semanticValidation(data, schema);
       await this.performanceAnalysis(data, schema);
       await this.authenticityVerification(data);
       
       return results;
     }
   }
   ```

3. **Migration Engine**
   ```python
   class MigrationEngine:
       def create_migration_plan(self, source_schema, target_schema):
           return {
               "steps": self.analyze_changes(source_schema, target_schema),
               "risk_assessment": self.calculate_risk_score(),
               "rollback_strategy": self.generate_rollback_plan(),
               "estimated_duration": self.estimate_migration_time(),
               "validation_checkpoints": self.define_checkpoints()
           }
   ```

4. **Monitoring Dashboard**
   - Real-time data quality metrics
   - Schema evolution timeline
   - Migration status tracking
   - Performance analytics
   - Anomaly alerts

### Benefits
- **Data Integrity**: 99.99% data consistency guarantee
- **Zero Downtime**: Seamless schema evolution without service interruption
- **Performance**: 40% reduction in query latency through optimized schemas
- **Security**: Cryptographic verification of critical data
- **Developer Experience**: Self-documenting schemas with validation rules
- **Cost Optimization**: Reduced storage through intelligent compression

### Success Metrics
- Schema validation processing < 10ms for 95% of requests
- Zero data loss during migrations
- 90% reduction in schema-related production issues
- Authenticity verification confidence > 99.5%
- Migration rollback time < 30 seconds

### Implementation Phases

**Phase 1: Foundation (Weeks 1-4)**
- Core schema registry implementation
- Basic validation engine
- Simple migration capabilities

**Phase 2: Enhancement (Weeks 5-8)**
- Content verification framework
- Performance optimization layer
- Advanced migration strategies

**Phase 3: Intelligence (Weeks 9-12)**
- Machine learning for anomaly detection
- Predictive schema optimization
- Automated performance tuning

### API Example
```typescript
interface SchemaEvolution {
  validate(data: any): ValidationResult;
  migrate(options: MigrationOptions): MigrationResult;
  verify(content: any): VerificationResult;
  optimize(schema: Schema): OptimizationSuggestions;
  monitor(): HealthMetrics;
}
```

### Dependencies
- JSON Schema Draft 2020-12
- Apache Avro for schema evolution
- PostgreSQL/MongoDB for schema registry
- Redis for caching layer
- Prometheus for metrics collection

### Related Issues
- Enhances overall system reliability
- Complements API versioning strategies
- Supports microservices data contracts
- Enables event sourcing patterns

### Additional Considerations
- Backward compatibility with existing data formats
- Integration with CI/CD pipelines
- Support for multiple data formats (JSON, Avro, Protobuf)
- Compliance with data governance requirements
- Multi-tenant schema isolation

This feature would position claude-nexus as a leader in self-healing, self-validating data architectures, ensuring data integrity while maintaining peak performance and developer productivity.

This automated health monitoring system would provide the foundation for sustainable repository management at scale, ensuring the claude-nexus ecosystem maintains high standards of code quality, security, and maintainability.

## 🎯 Feature Request Summary

As the Interface Artisan, I propose implementing a comprehensive Frontend Excellence Framework that transforms the claude-nexus ecosystem into a showcase of modern web development best practices. This enhancement will provide a responsive dashboard interface, accessibility-first design system, and performance optimization suite that demonstrates the power of our specialized agents.

## 🚀 Problem Statement

Currently, the claude-nexus ecosystem exists primarily as a collection of markdown documentation. While comprehensive, it lacks:

- **Interactive Discovery**: No visual interface for exploring agent capabilities
- **Accessibility Barriers**: Limited support for screen readers and keyboard navigation
- **Performance Baseline**: No established Core Web Vitals monitoring
- **Design Consistency**: Missing cohesive design system and component library
- **Mobile Experience**: No responsive design for mobile agent interaction

## 💡 Proposed Solution

### 🏗️ Core Components

#### 1. **Agent Discovery Dashboard**
- Interactive grid layout showcasing all 16 specialized agents
- Dynamic filtering by domain (Infrastructure, Development, Data, Security, etc.)
- Real-time agent status indicators and capability metrics
- Responsive card components with hover states and micro-interactions

#### 2. **Accessibility-First Design System**
- WCAG 2.1 AA/AAA compliant component library
- Screen reader optimized navigation with proper ARIA labels
- High contrast color palette with 4.5:1+ contrast ratios
- Keyboard-only navigation support with visible focus indicators
- Reduced motion preferences for vestibular disorder accommodation

#### 3. **Performance Optimization Suite**
- Core Web Vitals monitoring dashboard
- Lazy loading implementation for agent content
- Optimized asset delivery with WebP/AVIF image formats
- CSS-in-JS performance patterns with design tokens
- Bundle size optimization with code splitting strategies

#### 4. **Progressive Web App Features**
- Offline-first architecture for agent documentation access
- Service worker implementation for caching strategies
- Mobile-responsive design with touch-optimized interactions
- Push notification support for agent updates

### 🛠️ Technical Implementation

#### Frontend Stack
```typescript
// Proposed technology stack
- Framework: Next.js 14 with App Router
- Styling: Tailwind CSS + CSS-in-JS for dynamic theming
- Components: Radix UI primitives for accessibility
- Testing: Jest + Testing Library + Playwright for E2E
- Performance: Web Vitals API integration
- PWA: Workbox for service worker management
```

#### Component Architecture
```jsx
// Example component structure
<AgentDashboard>
  <SearchFilters />
  <AgentGrid>
    <AgentCard agent={reliabilityEngineer}>
      <AgentAvatar />
      <AgentMetrics />
      <AgentCapabilities />
      <InteractionButton />
    </AgentCard>
  </AgentGrid>
  <PerformanceMonitor />
</AgentDashboard>
```

#### Accessibility Features
- **Semantic HTML**: Proper heading hierarchy and landmark roles
- **Screen Reader Support**: Comprehensive alt text and ARIA descriptions
- **Keyboard Navigation**: Tab order optimization and skip links
- **Color Accessibility**: Multiple ways to convey information beyond color
- **Text Scaling**: Support for 200% zoom without horizontal scrolling

#### Performance Targets
- **Lighthouse Score**: 90+ across all categories
- **Core Web Vitals**: 
  - LCP < 2.5s (Largest Contentful Paint)
  - FID < 100ms (First Input Delay)  
  - CLS < 0.1 (Cumulative Layout Shift)
- **Bundle Size**: < 150KB initial JavaScript payload
- **Image Optimization**: Next-gen formats with responsive sizing

### 📱 Cross-Device Experience

#### Responsive Breakpoints
```css
/* Mobile-first responsive design */
- Mobile: 320px - 768px (touch-optimized agent cards)
- Tablet: 768px - 1024px (2-column agent grid)
- Desktop: 1024px+ (3-4 column grid with sidebar)
- Ultra-wide: 1440px+ (enhanced layout with additional context)
```

#### Mobile Optimizations
- Touch-friendly 44px minimum target sizes
- Swipe gestures for agent navigation
- Optimized typography scales for mobile reading
- Reduced data usage with adaptive image loading

## 🎨 Design System Specifications

### Color Palette
```css
/* Accessible color system */
:root {
  --primary-50: #f0f9ff;
  --primary-500: #3b82f6;
  --primary-900: #1e3a8a;
  --neutral-50: #f9fafb;
  --neutral-900: #111827;
  --success: #10b981;
  --warning: #f59e0b;
  --error: #ef4444;
}
```

### Typography Scale
```css
/* Responsive typography */
.text-xs { font-size: clamp(0.75rem, 0.7rem + 0.25vw, 0.875rem); }
.text-sm { font-size: clamp(0.875rem, 0.8rem + 0.375vw, 1rem); }
.text-base { font-size: clamp(1rem, 0.9rem + 0.5vw, 1.125rem); }
.text-lg { font-size: clamp(1.125rem, 1rem + 0.625vw, 1.25rem); }
```

### Component Tokens
```typescript
// Design token system
export const spacing = {
  xs: '0.25rem',   // 4px
  sm: '0.5rem',    // 8px
  md: '1rem',      // 16px
  lg: '1.5rem',    // 24px
  xl: '2rem',      // 32px
} as const;
```

## 🧪 Testing Strategy

### Accessibility Testing
- **Automated**: axe-core integration in CI/CD pipeline
- **Manual**: Screen reader testing with NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver
- **User Testing**: Accessibility user testing with assistive technology users

### Performance Testing

### Cross-Browser Testing

- **Mobile Browsers**: iOS Safari, Chrome Mobile, Samsung Internet
- **Accessibility Tools**: Testing with high contrast mode, zoom levels

## 📊 Success Metrics

### Design System

- [Next.js Performance Best Practices](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/building-your-application/optimizing)
- [Radix UI Accessibility Features](https://www.radix-ui.com/primitives/docs/overview/accessibility)

## 🏷️ Labels

`enhancement` `frontend` `accessibility` `performance` `design-system` `ux` `responsive-design` `pwa`

issue.title: Add Resilient API Integration Framework with Circuit Breaker and Retry Patterns

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

issue.body:
## Summary

Implement a comprehensive resilient API integration framework for the claude-nexus ecosystem that provides robust patterns for external API communication, failure handling, and service reliability.

## Problem Statement

Current API integrations in the ecosystem lack standardized resilience patterns, leading to:
- Cascading failures when external services are unavailable
- Poor user experience during service degradation
- Inconsistent error handling across different integrations
- Lack of observability into integration health and performance
- Manual intervention required during service outages

## Proposed Solution

Create a unified **Resilient Integration Framework** that includes:

### Core Components

1. **Circuit Breaker Pattern Implementation**
   - Configurable failure thresholds and timeout windows
   - Half-open state testing for service recovery
   - Metrics collection for failure rate monitoring
   - Integration with monitoring systems

2. **Intelligent Retry Mechanisms**
   - Exponential backoff with jitter
   - Retry budget management to prevent resource exhaustion
   - Configurable retry policies per integration type
   - Dead letter queue for failed requests

3. **Webhook Event Processing System**
   - Reliable event delivery with at-least-once guarantees
   - Event replay capabilities for failed processing
   - Webhook signature verification and security
   - Event ordering and deduplication

4. **Integration Health Monitoring**
   - Real-time health checks and SLA monitoring
   - Integration performance metrics and alerting
   - Dependency mapping and failure impact analysis
   - Auto-scaling based on integration load

### Technical Architecture

```typescript
interface ResilienceConfig {
  circuitBreaker: {
    failureThreshold: number;
    recoveryTimeout: number;
    monitoringWindow: number;
  };
  retry: {
    maxAttempts: number;
    backoffStrategy: 'exponential' | 'linear' | 'fixed';
    maxDelay: number;
    retryConditions: string[];
  };
  timeout: {
    connection: number;
    request: number;
    total: number;
  };
  fallback: {
    strategy: 'cache' | 'default' | 'alternative_service';
    config: Record<string, any>;
  };
}

interface IntegrationClient {
  execute<T>(request: ApiRequest): Promise<T>;
  getHealthMetrics(): HealthMetrics;
  configureFallback(strategy: FallbackStrategy): void;
}
```

## Implementation Plan

### Phase 1: Core Infrastructure (Week 1-2)
- [ ] Circuit breaker implementation with configurable thresholds
- [ ] Exponential backoff retry mechanism
- [ ] Request timeout and connection pooling
- [ ] Basic metrics collection

### Phase 2: Advanced Patterns (Week 3-4)
- [ ] Bulkhead pattern for resource isolation
- [ ] Fallback strategies (cache, default responses, alternative services)
- [ ] Rate limiting with token bucket algorithm
- [ ] Integration health checks and monitoring

### Phase 3: Webhook System (Week 5-6)
- [ ] Reliable webhook delivery system
- [ ] Event replay and dead letter queue
- [ ] Webhook security and signature verification
- [ ] Event ordering and deduplication

### Phase 4: Testing & Observability (Week 7-8)
- [ ] Chaos engineering test suite
- [ ] Integration testing framework
- [ ] Monitoring dashboard and alerting
- [ ] Performance benchmarking tools

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Circuit breaker prevents cascading failures during service outages
- [ ] Retry mechanisms respect API rate limits and reduce error rates by 90%
- [ ] Webhook system processes events with 99.9% reliability
- [ ] Integration health monitoring provides real-time visibility
- [ ] Comprehensive test suite covers failure scenarios
- [ ] Documentation includes integration patterns and best practices
- [ ] Performance impact is minimal (<5ms overhead per request)

## Benefits

1. **Improved System Reliability**: Prevent cascading failures and maintain service availability
2. **Better User Experience**: Graceful degradation during service issues
3. **Operational Excellence**: Reduced manual intervention and faster incident resolution
4. **Developer Productivity**: Standardized patterns reduce integration complexity
5. **Cost Optimization**: Efficient resource usage and reduced API costs

## Related Work

- Netflix Hystrix circuit breaker patterns
- AWS API Gateway retry and throttling
- Kubernetes service mesh resilience features
- Martin Fowler's circuit breaker pattern documentation

## Priority

**High** - Critical for production reliability and user experience

## Technical Considerations

### Error Handling Strategy
- Implement progressive fallback mechanisms
- Design user-friendly error messages that don't expose internal details
- Create error categorization system for appropriate handling

### Integration Testing
- Chaos engineering with controlled service failures
- Load testing under various failure scenarios
- End-to-end testing with external service mocks

### Monitoring & Alerting
- Real-time dashboards for integration health
- SLA monitoring with threshold-based alerts
- Performance metrics and trend analysis

issue.title: Performance Monitoring Dashboard for Agent Response Time Optimization

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

issue.body:
## Feature Request: Performance Monitoring Dashboard for Agent Response Time Optimization

### Problem Statement
Currently, the claude-nexus ecosystem lacks comprehensive performance monitoring and optimization capabilities for agent interactions. Users and developers have no visibility into:
- Agent response time patterns and bottlenecks
- Resource utilization during complex multi-step operations
- Performance degradation over time
- Scalability limits under concurrent usage

### Proposed Solution
Implement a performance monitoring dashboard that provides real-time and historical performance metrics for agent operations.

### Core Features

#### 1. Response Time Analytics
- **Agent Response Time Tracking**: Monitor latency for each agent interaction from request initiation to completion
- **Operation Breakdown**: Track time spent in different phases (planning, tool execution, response generation)
- **Percentile Analysis**: P50, P95, P99 response time distributions
- **Target**: Achieve <2s average response time for simple operations, <10s for complex multi-step tasks

#### 2. Resource Efficiency Monitoring
- **Memory Usage Patterns**: Track memory consumption during agent operations
- **CPU Utilization**: Monitor computational load during intensive tasks
- **Tool Execution Performance**: Individual tool performance metrics and bottleneck identification
- **Concurrent Operation Impact**: Performance degradation analysis under parallel usage

#### 3. Scalability Metrics
- **Throughput Monitoring**: Operations per minute/hour capacity tracking
- **Concurrent User Support**: Performance under multiple simultaneous agent sessions
- **Resource Scaling Indicators**: Automated alerts when approaching capacity limits
- **Load Testing Integration**: Built-in stress testing capabilities

#### 4. Performance Optimization Features
- **Bottleneck Detection**: Automated identification of performance constraints
- **Optimization Recommendations**: AI-powered suggestions for performance improvements
- **Caching Strategy Analysis**: Cache hit rates and effectiveness monitoring
- **Performance Regression Detection**: Automated alerts for performance degradation

### Technical Implementation

#### Dashboard Components
```
/performance-dashboard/
├── real-time-metrics/     # Live performance monitoring
├── historical-analysis/   # Trend analysis and reporting
├── bottleneck-detection/  # Automated performance issue identification
├── optimization-tools/    # Performance tuning utilities
└── alerting-system/       # Performance threshold monitoring
```

#### Key Metrics to Track
- **Response Time**: Agent interaction latency (target: <2s average)
- **Throughput**: Operations per second (target: >10 ops/sec)
- **Memory Efficiency**: Memory usage per operation (target: <100MB average)
- **CPU Utilization**: Computational efficiency (target: <70% peak usage)
- **Error Rates**: Performance-related failures (target: <1%)

#### Performance Benchmarks
- **Baseline Performance**: Establish current performance metrics
- **Optimization Targets**: 50% reduction in response time for common operations
- **Scalability Goals**: Support 100+ concurrent users with <20% performance degradation
- **Resource Efficiency**: 30% reduction in memory usage through optimization

### Success Criteria
- [ ] Real-time performance dashboard accessible via web interface
- [ ] Historical performance data retention (30 days minimum)
- [ ] Automated performance regression detection with alerts
- [ ] Performance optimization recommendations with quantified impact
- [ ] Load testing capabilities with scalability analysis
- [ ] Integration with existing agent workflows without performance overhead

### Benefits
- **Developer Experience**: Clear visibility into performance bottlenecks for optimization
- **User Experience**: Faster, more responsive agent interactions
- **Operational Excellence**: Proactive performance issue detection and resolution
- **Scalability Planning**: Data-driven capacity planning and resource allocation
- **Cost Optimization**: Efficient resource utilization and performance tuning

### Implementation Priority
**High Priority** - Performance monitoring is critical for production readiness and user satisfaction in agent-based systems.

### Related Issues
- Agent response time optimization
- Scalability testing framework
- Resource management improvements
- Performance regression testing

---

**Performance Impact**: This feature will provide the foundation for achieving 50%+ improvement in agent response times and enable proactive scalability planning for the claude-nexus ecosystem.

## ♿ **WCAG 2.1 AA COMPLIANCE IMPLEMENTATION** **PRIORITY**: P0 Critical - Accessibility compliance required **IMPACT**: +30 points quality improvement (35/100 → 65/100 accessibility category) **TIMELINE**: 2-3 weeks implementation **COMPLIANCE**: Legal requirement for government/enterprise contracts ### 🔍 **ACCESSIBILITY AUDIT FINDINGS** **Current Accessibility Score**: 35/100 ❌ CRITICAL FAILURE **WCAG 2.1 AA Requirement**: 95/100+ for compliance **Legal Risk**: Non-compliance with accessibility laws #### **Critical Accessibility Issues**: 1. **CRITICAL**: No WCAG 2.1 AA compliance testing performed 2. **HIGH**: Missing ARIA landmark navigation 3. **HIGH**: Insufficient semantic HTML5 structure 4. **MEDIUM**: No screen reader compatibility verification 5. **MEDIUM**: Color contrast ratio verification needed ### 📋 **IMPLEMENTATION REQUIREMENTS** #### **1. ARIA Landmark Navigation - IMMEDIATE** ```html
  • About
  • Experience
  • Projects

Professional Experience

``` #### **2. Semantic HTML5 Structure - HIGH PRIORITY** **Current (Problematic)**: ```html
Adrian Wedd
Systems Analyst
Experience
``` **Required (Semantic)**: ```html

Adrian Wedd

Systems Analyst & Developer

Professional Experience

© 2025 Adrian Wedd

``` #### **3. Screen Reader Optimization** ```html Skip to main content Skip to navigation
We'll never share your email with anyone else.
``` #### **4. Color Contrast & Visual Accessibility** ```css /* WCAG 2.1 AA requires minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio */ :root { --text-primary: #1a1a1a; /* 16.94:1 contrast on white */ --text-secondary: #4a4a4a; /* 9.74:1 contrast on white */ --link-color: #0066cc; /* 4.77:1 contrast on white */ --focus-outline: #005fcc; /* High contrast focus indicator */ } /* Focus indicators for keyboard navigation */ a:focus, button:focus, input:focus { outline: 3px solid var(--focus-outline); outline-offset: 2px; } /* Ensure text scales properly */ html { font-size: 100%; /* Respects user preferences */ } ``` ### 🧪 **TESTING REQUIREMENTS** #### **Automated Testing**: ```bash # Install accessibility testing tools npm install -D @axe-core/cli lighthouse # Run accessibility audits npx @axe-core/cli https://adrianwedd.github.io/cv npx lighthouse https://adrianwedd.github.io/cv --only-categories=accessibility # WAVE Web Accessibility Evaluation # Visit: https://wave.webaim.org/report#/https://adrianwedd.github.io/cv ``` #### **Manual Testing Checklist**: - [ ] **Keyboard Navigation**: Tab through all interactive elements - [ ] **Screen Reader**: Test with NVDA/JAWS/VoiceOver - [ ] **Color Contrast**: Verify 4.5:1 ratio for normal text, 3:1 for large text - [ ] **Text Scaling**: Ensure readability at 200% zoom - [ ] **Focus Indicators**: Visible focus states for all interactive elements ### 🎯 **SUCCESS CRITERIA** #### **Accessibility Score Targets**: - **Phase 1**: 35/100 → 60/100 (+25 points) - ARIA landmarks + semantic HTML - **Phase 2**: 60/100 → 80/100 (+20 points) - Screen reader optimization - **Phase 3**: 80/100 → 95/100 (+15 points) - WCAG 2.1 AA full compliance #### **Compliance Requirements**: - [ ] WCAG 2.1 AA Level compliance (95/100+) - [ ] Zero critical accessibility violations - [ ] Screen reader compatibility verified - [ ] Keyboard navigation fully functional - [ ] Color contrast ratios meet standards ### 🚀 **IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY** #### **Week 1: Semantic Structure Foundation** 1. Convert div-based layout to semantic HTML5 2. Implement ARIA landmark navigation 3. Add proper heading hierarchy (h1 → h2 → h3) 4. Basic keyboard navigation testing #### **Week 2: Enhanced Accessibility Features** 1. Add skip navigation links 2. Implement comprehensive ARIA attributes 3. Optimize for screen readers 4. Color contrast validation and fixes #### **Week 3: Testing & Compliance Verification** 1. Automated accessibility testing (axe-core, Lighthouse) 2. Manual screen reader testing 3. Keyboard navigation comprehensive testing 4. WCAG 2.1 AA compliance certification ### 🔗 **DEPENDENCIES & INTEGRATION** - **Requires**: Security infrastructure (#231) - secure foundation needed - **Enables**: SEO technical excellence (structured data benefits from semantic HTML) - **Blocks**: Enterprise client evaluation - accessibility is mandatory ### 📊 **BUSINESS & LEGAL IMPACT** **COMPLIANCE BENEFITS**: - Legal requirement for government contracts - Enterprise client accessibility standards - Search engine ranking improvement (accessibility signals) - Inclusive design demonstrates professional values **RISK MITIGATION**: - Avoids accessibility lawsuit exposure - Ensures compliance with disability rights legislation - Meets enterprise procurement requirements **QUALITY IMPROVEMENT**: +30 points toward authentic 100/100 enterprise score --- **Implementation Guide**: See `/.github/scripts/data/validation/implementation-guide-accessibility.md` **Testing Tools**: axe-core, Lighthouse, WAVE, screen readers **Compliance Standard**: WCAG 2.1 AA Level

issue.body:
## 🚨 **CRITICAL SECURITY IMPLEMENTATION REQUIRED**

**PRIORITY**: P0 Critical - Security vulnerabilities detected  
**IMPACT**: +60 points quality improvement (20/100 → 80/100 security category)  
**TIMELINE**: 1-2 weeks implementation  
**RISK**: Production exposure to XSS, CDN attacks, HTTPS bypass

### 🔍 **SECURITY AUDIT FINDINGS**

**Current Security Score**: 20/100 ❌ CRITICAL FAILURE  
**Enterprise Requirement**: 95/100+ for production deployment

#### **Critical Vulnerabilities Identified**:

1. **CRITICAL**: Missing Content Security Policy (CSP) - **XSS vulnerability exposure**
2. **CRITICAL**: No Strict Transport Security (HSTS) - **HTTPS not enforced**  
3. **HIGH**: Missing Subresource Integrity (SRI) - **CDN attack vulnerability**
4. **MEDIUM**: Incomplete security headers framework

### 📋 **IMPLEMENTATION REQUIREMENTS**

#### **1. Content Security Policy (CSP) - IMMEDIATE**
```html
<!-- Add to <head> section of index.html -->
<meta http-equiv="Content-Security-Policy" 
      content="default-src 'self'; 
               script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' https://cdn.jsdelivr.net; 
               style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; 
               img-src 'self' data: https:; 
               font-src 'self' https://fonts.gstatic.com;">
```

**Verification**:
```bash
curl -I https://adrianwedd.github.io/cv | grep -i content-security-policy
```

#### **2. Strict Transport Security (HSTS) - IMMEDIATE**
```html
<!-- Add to <head> section of index.html -->
<meta http-equiv="Strict-Transport-Security" 
      content="max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains">
```

**Verification**:
```bash
curl -I https://adrianwedd.github.io/cv | grep -i strict-transport-security
```

#### **3. Subresource Integrity (SRI) - HIGH PRIORITY**
```html
<!-- Update all external script/link tags -->
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/library@1.0.0/dist/lib.min.js" 
        integrity="sha384-oqVuAfXRKap7fdgcCY5uykM6+R9GqQ8K/uxy9rx7HNQlGYl1kPzQho1wx4JwY8wC" 
        crossorigin="anonymous"></script>
```

**Generate SRI Hashes**:
```bash
curl -s https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/library@1.0.0/dist/lib.min.js | openssl dgst -sha384 -binary | openssl base64 -A
```

#### **4. Additional Security Headers**
```html
<!-- Enhanced security header framework -->
<meta http-equiv="X-Content-Type-Options" content="nosniff">
<meta http-equiv="X-Frame-Options" content="DENY">
<meta http-equiv="Referrer-Policy" content="strict-origin-when-cross-origin">
<meta http-equiv="Permissions-Policy" content="geolocation=(), microphone=(), camera=()">
```

### 🎯 **SUCCESS CRITERIA**

#### **Security Score Targets**:
- **Phase 1**: 20/100 → 65/100 (+45 points) - CSP + HSTS implementation
- **Phase 2**: 65/100 → 85/100 (+20 points) - SRI + additional headers  
- **Phase 3**: 85/100 → 95/100 (+10 points) - Security audit compliance

#### **Verification Requirements**:
- [ ] CSP header present and functional
- [ ] HSTS enforces HTTPS redirection
- [ ] All external resources have SRI hashes
- [ ] No console security warnings
- [ ] Security scanner verification (OWASP ZAP)

### 🚀 **IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY**

#### **Week 1: Critical Headers**
1. Implement CSP meta tag with appropriate directives
2. Add HSTS header for HTTPS enforcement
3. Test all functionality with new security policies
4. Verify no console errors or blocked resources

#### **Week 2: Resource Integrity + Audit**
1. Generate and implement SRI hashes for all external resources
2. Add comprehensive security header framework
3. Run automated security scan (OWASP ZAP)
4. Document security implementation and testing procedures

### 🔗 **RELATED ISSUES**

- **Blocks**: All PWA and performance optimization (requires secure foundation)
- **Depends**: Quality validation framework (#230)
- **Follow-up**: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance implementation

### 📊 **BUSINESS IMPACT**

**RISK MITIGATION**: Eliminates critical security vulnerabilities affecting:
- Professional credibility and trust
- Search engine ranking (HTTPS requirement)
- Enterprise client evaluation criteria
- Compliance with modern web security standards

**QUALITY IMPROVEMENT**: +60 points toward authentic 100/100 enterprise score

---

**Implementation Guide**: See `/.github/scripts/data/validation/implementation-guide-security.md`  
**Testing Framework**: Comprehensive security validation available  
**Certification**: Required for CV-QV enterprise certification renewal
